intro: Edwardsia tetraptera, commonly known as the four-winged sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to coastal regions of the Mediterranean and the eastern coast of Africa. The plant is characterized by its four-winged fruits, which are adapted for dispersal by wind. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils near the shoreline, often in areas with high salt exposure. Its bright yellow flowers bloom during the summer months, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
